posts._title: Michael Gordon – An Act of Murder (1948)
posts.title: An Act of Murder
posts.excerpt: A hard-line judge is tempted toward mercy-killing by his wife’s terminal cancer. Quote:I find it interesting that An Act of Murder, The Third Man (Carol Reed), Obsession (Edward Dmytryk), The Set-Up (Robert Wise), Act of Violence (Fred Zinneman), House of Strangers (Joseph Mankiewicz) and Without Honor (Irving Pichel) were all in the main competition at …

posts._title: Gakuryû Ishii – Enjeru dasuto aka Angel Dust (1994)
posts.title: Enjeru dasuto
posts.excerpt: Every Monday at 6 pm a young woman is murdered in the subway. The psychiatrist Setsuko Suma is called in to assist the police. The trail leads to another psychiatrist – Dr Rei Aku – who Setsuko used to date. As she get closer to the solution, she gets more and more convinced that Aku’s …

posts._title: John Cromwell – Abe Lincoln in Illinois (1940)
posts.title: Abe Lincoln in Illinois
posts.excerpt: Plot:Among the most masterful matchups of actor and role in screen history is this stirring film of Robert E. Sherwood’s beloved play taking a thoroughly human look at the early years of our 16th President, with all his frailties and strength of character. Best Actor Oscar nominee* Raymond Massey (who originated the role on stage) …

posts._title: James Algar – A True-Life Adventure: White Wilderness (1958)
posts.title: A True-Life Adventure: White Wilderness
posts.excerpt: Quote:Six years worth of footage shot in Alberta, Canada has been condensed into a 72-minute documentary which offers a unique and touching look at the daily lives of animals such as polar bears, walruses, goldeneyes, wolverines, and, of course, lemmings. One of the most amusing and tender moments perhaps is when a young polar bear …

posts._title: João Batista de Andrade – A Próxima Vítima (1983)
posts.title: A Próxima Vítima
posts.excerpt: TV reporter tries to find out who is killing prostitutes in a São Paulo neighborhood.

posts._title: Júlio Bressane – A Família do Barulho (1970)
posts.title: A Família do Barulho
posts.excerpt: Claudio Carvalho, Rio de Janeiro, Brazil@IMDb wrote:A dysfunctional family, composed of a prostitute and two gays, one strong and the other fragile and stupid, lives a routine life in Rio de Janeiro. posts.title: Un Américain
posts.excerpt: An American sculptor settles in Paris, convinced that this city will be good for his work. However, to survive, he has to sell the New York Herald Tribune at night. The assistant director on this film was Maurice Pialat.

posts._title: Henry Barakat – Doa al karawan AKA The Nightingale’s Prayer (1959)
posts.title: Doa al karawan
posts.excerpt: Quote:This is a classical melodrama from Egypt and nicely shot in black and white. It is a tale of relations between man and woman, death, revenge and forgiveness. To watch a film is not just the moving images it is also a opportunity to travel in time and space. Here one is moved back too …

posts._title: Jacek Bromski – Sztuka kochania AKA Art of Loving (1989)
posts.title: Sztuka kochania
posts.excerpt: Sztuka Kochania is a satire about sex therapists and popular newspaper advice columnists. A young woman asks an advice columnist if her fiance is the right man for her, and should she get married to him. She follows the doctor’s advice and abruptly halts her wedding right at the altar. When the distraught woman then …

posts._title: Giorgio Ferroni – La Notte dei diavoli AKA Night of the Devils (1972)
posts.title: La Notte dei diavoli
posts.excerpt: Italian genre film legend Gianni Garko stars in this terrifying masterpiece of the macabre, based on Tolstoy’s story The Wurdulak, itself previously adapted in Mario Bava’s Black Sabbath. A nameless mentally ill man (Garko) is found wandering in the woods, his mind lost in fever dreams of gruesome, sexual imagery. After admitted into a psychiatric …
